intro: Lepechinia mecistandrum, commonly known as the sticky lepechinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its unique morphology and chemical composition make it of interest in ecological and pharmacological studies.
